descriptionHtml:
[b]INTRO

I downloaded many player house mods, and I like them all, but I came across the problem that noone of them fits my need compleetly. Some of them are too big, some are too small, lots of them have stuff I don't really like and missing the stuff I need. And since most of the modders don't allow to modify their mods, I decided to make my own one. That's why I started this project.

The idea was to make the classic Lovecraftian/Amnesia style mansion with magic laboratory, huge library, hidden doors and rooms,Â  basemet with altars, daedric shrines [/b]and other "dark" stuff.
And then I came across an other problem: I spent a lot of time for only one hall, retexturing and positioning parts (not even started placing scripted elements). And even bigger problem - I don't know how exactly this house should look - where's gonna be bedroom or library, how big it should be and a stuff like that.
I'm not sure if I will finish this poject so I decided to upload what is already done for someone more skillfull could use it.

DESCRIPTION

This is basicly a pack of retextured meshes - walls, floors, columns, stairs and a hidden panel-door. All meshes are vanilla, woden pannel texture is taken somewhere from the internet (dont remember when and where exactly)

PERMISSIONS

You can use the full room or any part of it your creation IF:
1. You credit me and give a link to this page.
2. You notify me. Just give me the link to your mod when it's uploaded, no asking is needed:). Maybe it will give me the idea of where to move.
3. You allow me to use any part of your mod that has my elements (with the credit off cource). Sounds fair to me.
4. NO COMMERCIAL USE! (because F*** the commerce!).

I think I'm not asking for much, so.. take it and have fun:)

p.s. Sorry my English, I'm not the native speaker.
______________________________________

If someone can help with the trianglle floor parts in library - I will be very thankful! Seems like they're bigger then they look and character's just walking around on the air.
author: Alex Hermaeus
